poem:
Title: "Portrait Unveiled"

Under the shroud of politics,
A man unfolds, his soul's prick and pebbles,
Nailed to a cross of his own making.
An echo not his own, yet carried,
In whispers of unrest. 
Racism etched in stony heart,
Fraught laces of betrayal trail,
The bracken lined path to Parliament.
Fear not the fraud, but the silence,
The echoed refrain of complacency.
